Letter of protest to Bush handed to U.S. Ambassador to S. Korea
    Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- Assemblymen under the Measure Committee for Status of Forces Agreement from the South Korean Democratic Party visited the U.S. embassy in Seoul on December 3 and handed to the ambassador a letter of protest to Bush against the killing of two schoolgirls, according to KBS of South Korea.
 The letter, signed by 21 assemblymen from the Democratic Party, demanded personal apology of President Bush for the incident, nullification of a verdict of not guilty given to GI criminals, transfer of jurisdiction, the revision of South Korea-U.S. Status of Forces Agreement, etc.

articles.content:
U.S. criticized for failing to implement AF 
    Pyongyang, December 7 (KCNA) -- Seleznyov, speaker of the State Duma of the Russian Federation, at a press conference in Tokyo, Japan, on December 3 called for denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and accused the U.S. of failing to fulfill its obligation to the DPRK, according to Itar-Tass.
 He said that the U.S. did nothing, failing to implement its obligation to provide two light water reactors to the DPRK for production of electric power in return for the DPRK stop of its nuclear program.
